Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Uptake of Oral Tranexamic Acid During Active Labor

Trial_Design.evidence: In this open-label, single-center pilot study, 51 women ≥36 gestational weeks with planned vaginal delivery at Södersjukhuset, Stockholm, were randomized 1:1:1:1

Participants.evidence: 51 women ≥36 gestational weeks with planned vaginal delivery at Södersjukhuset, Stockholm

Intervention.evidence: randomized 1:1:1:1 to receive 2 g of TA as an oral solution, tablets, effervescent tablets, or 1 g of intravenous TA

Objective.evidence: This study aims to evaluate the uptake of oral TA during active labor.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were time to therapeutic level, duration in the therapeutic interval, and maximum plasma concentration.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Therapeutic levels were reached at 2 hours for oral (7.11 ± 3.31 mg/L) and 30 minutes for intravenous forms (30.6 ± 15.0 mg/L). Duration in therapeutic intervals was 6 hours for oral and 3.5 hours for intravenous forms (p < 0.007). Peak plasma concentrations were 10.2 ± 3.9 mg/L for oral and 30.6 ± 15.0 mg/L for intravenous forms (p < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported, with 12% of participants experiencing mild side effects such as nausea and vomiting.
